page.title: 10 THEATRES
page.content: In Northampton there are two main theatres:the Royal Theatre which is over one hundred years old and very famous, and the recently built multi-purpose Derngate Centre adjacent to it. The Royal Theatre is the only one of its kind in Britain. Most other theatres are named "Theatre Royal". It was originally an opera house when it was first opened in May of 1884. The price for seats is at a standard rate of four pounds, seventy-five pence. Its most popular production has been "Blood Brothers". The Derngate was built upon the site of the town's old United Counties 'Bus Station at a cost of over nine million pounds.
